title: What are Lee Sin's weaknesses?
body:

Lee Sin is actually a pretty "Meh" champion without the mechanics to utilize his kit properly.

In fact, InSec is really the one who popularized Lee Sin's place in the competitive scene by showing off the crazy things you can do with his kit. Things that are considered staples of Lee today like ward-hopping into his titular move, the "Insec", where you hop or flash behind behind the enemy team and kick the carry into yours.
Wasn't Azir also balanced around "being difficult to play?" And we all know what happened to him. Ease of play should not be a factor in how much power they have.

And we see what happened to Azir too. He was literally pick/ban for two seasons before Riot nerfed him into the ground. He was an unstoppable monster in the LCS that literally destroyed everyone. I played Azir a lot at the height of his power and after ~100 games with him, you start to figure out how he works and he's just scary.

He was, rather. Now he's just unplayable and he'll stay that way until they rework him. They simply can't afford Azir becoming the Season 3 Renekton of mid lane. Basically, a meta of, "If it can't lane vs Azir, it's not viable mid." which did happen for a while.

And the jungle is dictated by Lee Sin. If they can't survive an invade from him or keep up with his gank pressure, they aren't viable. I'm surprised Shaco hasn't been used more against him since his early game cheese is just as strong as Lee's, albeit with an even worse late game.

Well, the main things about being able to play Lee are:

1. Having the mechanics and knowledge to use these
2. Know when to change your playstyle according to the phase of the game

Sure, these are standard things, but even more important with Lee than with most champs. Lee just is too good at too many things. He's an early game powerhouse with huge damage, transists to kind of an mobile engage fighter in mid game and becomes a utility off-tank in late.
The problem about him his, if he plays carefully and knows his champ well enough to be reliable, he's the only to be able to really counter and kill himself.
He might not be the best at anything, but he's the best at being a little bit of everything, while still having a very clear path to go throughout the game.

He has damage early and mid game, but is in the same boat with Pantheon when late game comes.

He DOES die quickly in team fights if you focus him down. He isn't as squishy as an ADC, obviously, but he is no tank.
The current most common Lee build is {{item:1408}} {{item:3117}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3742}} {{item:3156}} {{item:3026}}.

Only two of those items are full on defensive, and one of them not only has a cooldown but also sets him up to get burst down again when it revives him. 

He doesn't have that much CC. His E doesn't really count, since that slow sucks ass. Besides that, he has **one** cc spell. Yes, it's a good one (if they position in a way that allows you to use it well), but he is hardly Nautilus.

He DOES have problems in sustained fights. Most of Lee's damage is burst. His sustained damage isn't the worst out there, but it's pretty far down there as far as fighters go. Lee doesn't GET a shield in most fights, since the shield just doesn't happen if he uses W to ward hop (which he most likely will). 30% lifesteal and spell vamp is significant, but since his sustained damage is so mediocre, he doesn't benefit too much from it.

Have you ever played an energy champion? It doesn't seem like you have, if you think that he can just "Hurr Durr no cost spells yayyy!". No. 
Energy champions don't have to manage their resources much outside of fights (laning, farming, etc) but in exchange they have it **MUCH** harder when it comes to in combat resource management. In the case of Lee Sin, each spell costs 15-25% of his resource pool. If he spams, he runs OOE and dies. His passive helps, but not so much that he can just mindlessly face roll.

I'll give you mobility. He is certainly fast.

Seriously, you didn't even TRY to think of weaknesses. You literally just listed his strengths (and misrepresented them quite a bit at that).

No, I think we need to change the 340 base damage on his Q not even including any %missing health -_-

That's higher than the abilities of Juggernauts, I believe.

If anything I think they should up the % missing health scaling and decrease the base damage. Making part of its damage budget % missing health scaling means he does more damage with it if he uses AFTER he goes in and lands a full rotation than if he uses it to initiate.

Lee Sin with it: Ward W>E>Q>R>Q. Ends up having to blow both of his mobility spells and a ward to dive a target optimally.
Lee Sin without it: Q>Q>E>R. He ends up having safeguard to get out if he needs to.


Also since shifting more of it's damage to % missing HP it makes Lee Sin a worse at poke and short trades against healthy enemies.

It's not about ratios, it's the playstyle. Same reason wukong's attack speed buff on his e is almost pointless late game; He has to do his full combo fast enough to take them surprise so that it is effective. Late game teamfights he's not going to weave in 6 autos on a squishy. He'll get cc'd and 5 shotted by the ad carry if he does that.  He can't even kill some squishy champions with his ideal combos because they'll just kill him faster. 

Don't compare damage outputs of other classes and divers. All other divers' damages scale so much harder into the late game despite his ratios. They all end up being able to do their job better than him. Camille? Wukong? Diana? They do fewer things than lee, but they're MUCH better at those things than lee is. 

Scaling isn't just about damage. It's about how spammable something is, how easy it is to apply/hit, and how much danger comes with using it. Lee's entire kit is suicidal and dangerous late game. Wukong can just w-> ghostblade -> e -> r and he succeeds late game and does massive damage. It doesn't matters that he has a lot of potential damage in perfect scenarios. If it did matter that much, we'd see much heavier AD builds than we do. Late game, he is weaker than a lot of other champions. He just can't duel divers, skirmishers, or juggernauts late, his cc isn't great, and he offers very little utility to his team. He's never going to be able just sit and auto an adc to death, beause 2 seconds of cc late game is his death.

Lee Sin's immune system is rather underdeveloped. Specifically, he is extremely weak to the disease commonly known as "Lee Syndrome".

In other words, Lee's weakness is stupid Lee players.

In team fights Lee sin is melee making him prone to being focused, relies on a stamina bar which doesn't scale, if he misses his Q, he can't engage or really do anything unless an opportunity presents itself and if he fails he simply dies. Lategame comes and his team will now rely on his kick to work because he hasn't got something like Elise's cacoon, Hecarim's charge, or Ivern's Q to lock down or disrupt team fights.
His biggest weakness is that he can run out of wards. DUH!
